Un juego que me trae much√≠sima nostalgia y por eso mismo lo he rejugado estos √∫ltimos d√≠as. En apenas tres horas (cuatro v√≠deos de unos 40 minutos) he completado el juego tras casi una d√©cada apartado en mi biblioteca.

Ha sido inevitable cantar algunas partes de la canci√≥n de "Still Alive" al finalizar el juego. La letra estaba en castellano, por lo que no pude hacer karaoke y tirar de recuerdos (he escuchado la canci√≥n cientos y cientos de veces, est√° en mi m√≥vil y a√∫n la reproduzco).

¬øEs bueno el juego? S√ç, CON MAY√öSCULAS. ¬øEs corto? Tambi√©n, por desgracia.

No s√© si me dur√≥ lo mismo la primera vez o quiz√° por no conocer la soluci√≥n a los puzles me lleg√≥ a durar las 5 o 6 horas, no lo recuerdo, pero la sensaci√≥n que da al finalizarlo es que a 8‚Ç¨ quiz√° no merece la pena los 2‚Ç¨/h por los que sale, as√≠ que... ¬°aprovecha cualquier oferta para comprarlo!

El juego es sencillo y no supone un reto muy dif√≠cil, pero te sientes satisfecho tras superar algunas pruebas y eso compensa.

Its awesome. Incredible puzzles and secrets, easter eggs, etc. It is short, which is a shame, but whatever. The game is one of those games you come back to again and again. The story introduced throughout the game isnt very eloquent, where Portal 2 focuses more on story than its predecesor. Portal 1 is more of a game to play for the fun interesting puzzles, less for the story. HIGHLY recommend, as it is cheap in price and aged incredibly, still exciting in 2018. Worth AT LEAST a try

One of the best puzzle games of all time. Portal is a game where you play as a test subject with a portal gun, having the ability to create 2 portals & use your companion cube to solve the levels.

The puzzles are really interesting & keep evolving as your progress, from simple button pushes and pressure plates to using infinite loops to fly across the map.

The game has fantastic humour, characters & a memorable sound track to listen to throughout the story.

I would highly recommend that everyone plays this game.

This was a triumph.
I'm making a note here: HUGE SUCCESS.
It's hard to overstate my satisfaction.
Aperture Science
We do what we must
because we can.
For the good of all of us.
Except the ones who are dead.
But there's no sense crying over every mistake.
You just keep on trying till you run out of cake.
And the Science gets done.
And you make a neat gun.
For the people who are still alive.
I'm not even angry.
I'm being so sincere right now.
Even though you broke my heart.
And killed me.
And tore me to pieces.
And threw every piece into a fire.
As they burned it hurt because I was so happy for you!
Now these points of data make a beautiful line.
And we're out of beta.
We're releasing on time.
So I'm GLaD. I got burned.

Think of all the things we learned
for the people who are still alive.
Go ahead and leave me.
I think I prefer to stay inside.
Maybe you'll find someone else to help you.
Maybe Black Mesa
THAT WAS A JOKE.
HAHA. FAT CHANCE.
Anyway, this cake is great.
It's so delicious and moist.
Look at me still talking
when there's Science to do.
When I look out there, it makes me GLaD I'm not you.
I've experiments to run.
There is research to be done.
On the people who are still alive.
And believe me I am still alive.
I'm doing Science and I'm still alive.
I feel FANTASTIC and I'm still alive.
While you're dying I'll be still alive.
And when you're dead I will be still alive.
STILL ALIVE

[h1] Portals equal science... duh [/h1]
    I love the concept and enviroment of this game. It makes you feel like you're trapped and manipulated to do these "tests" or puzzles chambers. You have a goal and something to achieve, escape and freedom. As simple as it sounds, it makes this a pretty deep but shallow game at the same time. While having a basic design and basic gamplay, it innovates a whole new genre in gaming.

    Lets talk game mechanics. When I said basic gameplay I meant it as easy to understand kind of basic. The portal physics and momentum makes the portals more believable. All you need to know is that you can manipulate these portals any way you want to. This ingredient of this game recipe is its main ingredient. 

    Lets talk level design. Since this is a puzzle style game based on portals, you would think the levels would be clusterd and confusing, you would be right to an extent. The beginning levels of portal are simple and easy to figure out, this continues but at the same time it teaches you something about your abilites. One level might urge you to bring a test cube out of a box while another urges you to fling yourself onto a cube despenser button. This is good level design, something that teaches you something about the game, your abilites, progress (like chamber numbers) and chamber expectations or hints next to the chamber number. Though the level may look simple, it could be the hardest one you've come across and thats what makes the level design fun and suprisingly satisfying to figure out.  

    Lets talk story. The lore and story for this game are shallow and lacks protagonist development. Of course thats not a bad thing to have a silent protagonist as it makes the game more emersive to feel like its you, the player, who GlaDOS is talking too. As far as story goes it does go somewhere. As you progress in game, GLaDOS becomes more currupt and refers to Chell's (who you play as) history and even name at some point. Since Chell can't talk, GLaDOS acts as a narrator throughout each level. Since there is some story throughout portal, I wont spoil any juicy details if you havent played it yet. Just remember that you're not the only human alive in the facility. 

    Portal is a simple but mind-exercising game that takes you on an intersting ride with one antagonist and one goal, freedom. Its popularity gave inspiration upon the 3D 1st person puzzle genre and continues to with its greatly polished metanarrative sequel, portal 2.

~If you were wondering how I beat the game in an hour, I didnt. I beat the game on my Xbla 360 with orange box. and decided to compare PC gamplay with the 360's, so far I think they are both great ways to play portal!

You wake up in a weird facility. You are given a gun that makes portals. All you need to do is solve the test chambers. Simple. Right? Portal is a classic game which really defined the FPP (First-person puzzle) genre. The game starts quite easy with the puzzles become trickier as you advance, but at a reasonable pace. The game controls great, and the textures have aged surprisingly well. The dialogue will have you in stitches. There is more than meets the eye with this one, and it is definetely a game you'll want to play over and over again. But, if you think about it, do you really have any other choice?
It is a pretty good puzzle game that lived up to my expectations.
really good game.
The most creative and fun puzzle game I have ever played. Still holds up 10+ years later

Portal is an awesome game, in every possible way. This is one of those games that will be in classic gaming libraries for future generations. Aside from being an awesome game, Portal is a first person puzzle game (FPP anyone?) 

There are no monster to shoot up or kill, so forget that type of game. You do have an enemy (sort of), but I wont spoil it, that's for you to discover. 

Portal requires you to use your brains rather than muscles to advance as it is a FPP. You will be a master of portals, hence the name of the game. You will blast your way through mazes that are so well done, that once you finish the game, you will have that proud feeling of achievement, just like handing in a term paper for school and acing it. You know that feeling, right? ;)

The thing that amazes me the most with the game though, is the balancing, some levels are tricky to solve, yes, but they are not on an impossible level, and you won't most likely have to youtube any of your answers. That to me, is a testament of great testing and level design. This is where testing is so important for a game, to be able to create levels that are so balanced that anyone can achieve and finish levels, yet be challenging enough to keep on going and wanting to discover, what's next? I can't wait to play another level, just one more and so on :) 

Not to many games today are so well thought out. The game itself is around 3-4 hours of wonderful gameplay, and worth the price, no matter if you can get it on sale or not. Ranging everything from 5-15$, easily. And apparently there is a huge community making levels beyond as well as you yourself can create levels for this awesome game (nothing im personally into, but still it's a great way to play extended levels and challenges if you want more goodies.

The graphics are what they are, you are not going into this game for the graphics or the music really, so I'll put that aside for this game.

Last note: Get this game, it's a must. It's fun, it's engaging and really just pure love and passion, what else do you really want from a game?
Short game but fun. [spoiler] Portal 2 is better tho. [/spoiler]

if you compare this game with portal 2, it's pretty average, if you compare it with nothing then its... a bit better, it's really short for a 10 dollar game, worth more along the lines of 5 dollars and the energy ball puzzles aren't very good and the end bosfight is a bit lacking, you have the portal sentry shoot rockets through your portal onto GLaDoS and throw her cores into an incenerator, but the end song is amazing.

Im going to give an indepth review as usual. This game is definetely one of the best puzzle games valve has ever made, and was deserving of a sequel. Glados turns into a little b**** and we can see this happening as the story is really easy to follow.

Multiplayer mode is not in this game yet implemented this in Portal 2. The graphics are top notch. For Windows 10 laptop, the graphics are brilliance and same with gameplay. Overall, pretty nice.

TLDR: BY THE FRICKEN GAME ALREADY!!!

Ok, so Portal. The greatest game I've every played. This was also the first game I've ever played in my life, and it was a great experience playing it again. I would rate it 10/10. There is nothing I have against this game. There is nothing wrong with the levels, the graphics, the commentary, the humor. NOTHING, is wrong with this game. It's only $9.99 please by it. You will treat yourself to the best game  ever. It is a masterpiece of a game. Valve worked so hard on it, and it's amazing it's still relevant. Please buy it and feel free to review, and tell your friends. This game, has stood the test of time.
